result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamesha J Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lamesha J Chapman
Current: 2024 W CLARKE ST, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 05-08-2015)
Prior: 1603 West Wright Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $0 entered as ordered by the court on to pay $0 monthly.  Final payment due by XX/XX/XX. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Assessment for Attorney Fees entered in Error. DZ

Defendant Lamesha J Chapman in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to both counts:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months as to each count, consecutive,  in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Complete anger management classes.
- Complete parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the agent, and not until the defendant has participated in 1/2 of the parenting classes.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Lamesha J Chapman in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
On state's motion and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 1 and 2 amended to:  Misdemeanor Battery, pursuant to Wisc. stats.  940.19(1).
As to both charges as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.
Case adjourned for a sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense's Response To State's Motion For Continuance Of Jury Trial received and filed.

Defendant Lamesha J Chapman in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am and Jury Trial August 31, 2015 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Lamesha J Chapman in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Abbey DeSiato for Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Status conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamesha J Chapman in court with attorney Eamon Collins Guerin.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Rudolph Verhovven.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Case is adjourned to branch 23 for an Arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LME (DOB 11/13/2001) and LNE (DOB 11/13/2001), unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (05/12/2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Lamesha J Chapman in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/11/15 @ 1:30pm
